div.div: Difference in harvest and biomass under the Full Adaptation strategy in 2100 relative to today for RCP 6.0.
div.p: The bubble size corresponds to current MSY, and the colors indicate fishery category based on current biomass and fishing mortality rate relative to B MSY and F MSY, respectively. The fishery categories are defined as follows: Healthy ( F/ F MSY < 1, B/ B MSY ≥ 1), Emerging ( F/ F MSY ≥ 1, B/ B MSY ≥ 1), Recovering ( F/ F MSY < 1, B/ B MSY < 1), and Overfished ( F/ F MSY ≥ 1, B/ B MSY < 1). A transparent bubble indicates a decrease in maximum sustainable yield in 2100 relative to today, whereas a solid bubble indicates an increase (see fig. S2 for results under the other RCPs). MT, metric tons.
